SEARCH
Package common

Class Path

java.lang.Object
common.Path
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable, Comparable<Path>, Iterable<String>
public class Path extends Object implements Iterable<String>, Comparable<Path>, Serializable
Distributed filesystem paths.

Objects of type Path are used by all filesystem interfaces. Path objects are immutable.

The string representation of paths is a forward-slash-delimited sequence of path components (e.g., "/dir/file"). The root directory is represented as a single forward slash.

The colon (':'), semicolon (';'), forward slash ('/'), and space (' ') characters are not permitted within path components. The forward slash is the delimiter between path components, colon and semicolon are avoided for OS reasons, and space is avoided to allow string parsing using space-delimiters.

See Also:

  • Constructor Details

    • Path

      public Path()
      Default Path constructor: - Creates a new path which represents the root directory.

    • Path

      public Path(Path path, String component)
      Appending Path constructor: - Creates a new path by appending a file name to an existing directory path.
      Parameters:
      path - The existing path representing a directory.
      component - The new component representing a file name.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If component is null, empty, or includes any characters that are not permitted.

    • Path

      New Path constructor: - Creates a new Path from a String which starts with a forward slash and includes a sequence of forward-slash-delimited components.
      Parameters:
      path - The path string.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If path is null, empty, or includes any characters that are not permitted.

  • Method Details

    • iterator

      public Iterator<String> iterator()
      Returns an iterator over the components of the path.

      The iterator cannot be used to modify the path object - the remove method is not supported.

      Specified by:
      iterator in interface Iterable<String>
      Returns:
      The iterator.

    • list

      public static Path[] list(File directory) throws FileNotFoundException
      Lists the paths of all files in a directory tree on the local filesystem.
      Parameters:
      directory - The root directory of the directory tree.
      Returns:
      An array of relative paths, one for each file in the directory tree.
      Throws:
      FileNotFoundException - If the root directory does not exist.
      IllegalArgumentException - If directory exists but does not refer to a directory.

    • listFiles

      private static void listFiles(File directory, List<Path> paths, Path parentPath)
      Helper method to list files in a directory tree.
      Parameters:
      directory - The root directory of the directory tree.
      paths - The list of paths to which to add the paths of files in the directory tree.
      parentPath - The path of the parent directory of the directory tree.

    • appendToPath

      private static Path appendToPath(Path parentPath, String childName)
      Helper method to append a child name to a parent path.
      Parameters:
      parentPath - The parent path.
      childName - The name of the child.
      Returns:
      The new path.

    • isRoot

      public boolean isRoot()
      Determines whether the path represents the root directory.
      Returns:
      true if the path does represent the root directory, and false if it does not.

    • parent

      public Path parent()
      Returns the path to the parent of this path.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If the path represents the root directory, and therefore has no parent.

    • last

      public String last()
      Returns the last component in the path.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If the path represents the root directory, and therefore has no last component.

    • isSubpath

      public boolean isSubpath(Path other)
      Determines if the given path is a subpath of this path.

      The other path is a subpath of this path if it is a prefix of this path. Note that by this definition, each path is a subpath of itself.

      Parameters:
      other - The path to be tested.
      Returns:
      true If and only if the other path is a subpath of this path.

    • compareTo

      public int compareTo(Path other)
      Compares two paths lexicographically.

      The comparison is based on the relative ordering of path components. The root directory is the highest component, and is followed by subdirectories in lexicographic order. The root directory is less than any subdirectory.

      Specified by:
      compareTo in interface Comparable<Path>
      Parameters:
      other - The other path to be compared.
      Returns:
      A negative integer, zero, or a positive integer as this path is less than, equal to, or greater than the other path.

    • equals

      public boolean equals(Object other)
      Compares two paths for equality.

      Two paths are equal if they have the same components.

      Overrides:
      equals in class Object
      Parameters:
      other - The other path to be compared.
      Returns:
      true if the two paths are equal, and false if they are not.
